page.title: 03ATTITUDES.
page.content: Religious beliefs, or lack of them, are now more openly discussed but a small minority maintains the ancient church. Any hint of collapse or closure arouses keen but short lived interest. At least six families travel out of the village to worship elsewhere. Social attitudes differ horizontally between some recent arrivals and true natives, particularly in what they expect from village life. On the one hand a desire to urbanise with street lighting, mains drainage and an adventure playground; on the other, a desire for the status quo, if not an impossible return to 'things as they used to be'. As in all walks of life there are differing attitudes in a vertical sense between generations,most obvious here between farming fathers and sons.
